sentence.Network_en: South American palm yielding a wax similar to carnauba wax.

sentence.Network_en: Carnauba is the hardest natural occurring wax available.

sentence.Network_en: Carnauba wax: Very hard wax obtained from fronds of the carnauba tree, Copernicia apalm of Brazil.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from Portuguese, from Tupi

means.word_mean: 1. hard yellowish to brownish wax from leaves of the carnauba palm used especially in floor waxes and polishes
2. Brazilian fan palm having an edible root; source of a useful leaf fiber and a brittle yellowish wax
